org.jetel.data.lookup

Interface LookupTable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IGraphElement, java.lang.Iterable<DataRecord>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBLookupTable, RangeLookupTable, SimpleLookupTable

    public interface LookupTable
extends IGraphElement, java.lang.Iterable<DataRecord>

    The interface of a lookup table specifying the minimum required functionality.

    The intended use of a lookup table is the following:

    1. create/obtain an instance of the LookupTable
    2. call the IGraphElement.init() method to populate the lookup table and prepare it for use
    3. use the put(DataRecord) and remove(DataRecord) methods to manage the lookup data records
    4. use the createLookup(RecordKey) or createLookup(RecordKey, DataRecord) for lookup
    5. call the IGraphElement.free() method to free the resources used by the lookup table
    Since:
    8th July 2004
    See Also:
    Lookup

    • Method Detail

      • isPutSupported

        boolean isPutSupported()

        Determines whether the lookup table supports the put(DataRecord) method.

        Returns:
        true if the method is supported, false otherwise
        Since:
        10th November 2008

      • isRemoveSupported

        boolean isRemoveSupported()

        Determines whether the lookup table supports the remove(DataRecord) and remove(HashKey) methods.

        Returns:
        true if the methods are supported, false otherwise
        Since:
        10th November 2008

      • getMetadata

        DataRecordMetadata getMetadata()

        Returns the metadata associated with the data records stored in this lookup table.

        Returns:
        an instance of the DataRecordMetadata class

      • getKeyMetadata

        DataRecordMetadata getKeyMetadata()
                                  throws ComponentNotReadyException

        Returns metadata used to create the lookup proxy object by calling any of the createLookup(RecordKey) or createLookup(RecordKey, DataRecord) methods.

        Returns:
        metadata that is used for joining records
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the key cannot be obtained
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if metadata is not set by user and can't be obtained for external source (eg. database)
        Since:
        7th November 2008

      • put

        boolean put(DataRecord dataRecord)

        Puts the given data record into the lookup table. This method will work properly iff the isPutSupported() method returns false.

        Parameters:
        dataRecord - the data record to be put into the lookup table
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not supported
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data record is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data record is not compatible with the lookup table metadata
        Since:
        23rd October 2008

      • remove

        boolean remove(DataRecord dataRecord)

        Removes the given data record from the lookup table. This method will work properly iff the isPutSupported() method returns false.

        Parameters:
        dataRecord - the data record to be removed from the lookup table
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not supported
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data record is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data record is not compatible with the lookup table metadata
        Since:
        23rd October 2008

      • remove

        boolean remove(HashKey key)

        Removes records from the lookup table stored with given key. This method will work properly iff the isPutSupported() method returns false.

        Parameters:
        key - the hash key to be removed from the lookup table
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not supported
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given hash key is null
        Since:
        23rd October 2008

      • clear

        void clear()

        Attempts to free memory by erasing internal caches of the lookup table.

        Behavior in different LookupTable implementations can differ and can give different results. Clearing the caches may result in LookupTable having no entries, for other implementations it might only result in higher memory available after the LookupTable is cleared, and worse performance once the LookupTable is used again.

      • createLookup

        Lookup createLookup(RecordKey lookupKey)
                    throws ComponentNotReadyException

        Creates a lookup proxy object for the given lookup key. Returned proxy object can be used to retrieve data records associated with the given lookup key via the Iterator<DataRecord> interface. Lookup proxy object can also be used for continuous searching based on the same key and different data records.

        Parameters:
        lookupKey - a record key that will be used for lookup
        Throws:
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given lookup key is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given lookup key is not compatible with this lookup table
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured
        Since:
        29th October 2008
        See Also:
        Lookup

      • createLookup

        Lookup createLookup(RecordKey lookupKey,
                  DataRecord dataRecord)
                    throws ComponentNotReadyException

        Creates a lookup proxy object for the given lookup key. Returned proxy object can be used to retrieve data records associated with the given lookup key via the Iterator<DataRecord> interface. Lookup proxy object can also be used for continuous searching based on the same key and different data records.

        A lookup table implementation can take advantage of the second parameter to prepare a lookup query that can be reused by simple refilling the specified instance of the DataRecord class.

        Parameters:
        lookupKey - a record key that will be used for lookup
        dataRecord - a data record that will be used for future lookup queries
        Throws:
        NotInitializedException - if the lookup table has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given lookup key or data record is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given lookup key is not compatible with this lookup table
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured
        Since:
        29th October 2008
        See Also:
        Lookup

      • setCurrentPhase

        void setCurrentPhase(int phase)
        Setter for the current phase when graph is running;
        Parameters:
        phase -
